meanings.definition: To cry feebly or querulously; whimper.
meanings.sent1: The kitten mewled softly for its mother.
meanings.sent2: The baby mewled when it was hungry.
meanings.sent3: The puppy mewled in protest when bath time came.
meanings.sent4: The wind mewled through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The lost child mewled for help in the dark forest.

meanings.sent1: The sad mewled of the kitten touched my heart.
meanings.sent2: The mewled of the puppy could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly mewled echoed in the old haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The mewled of the wind sounded like a lonely spirit.
meanings.sent5: The eerie mewled in the night sent shivers down my spine.
